channel.title: Mental Wanderings on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in Mental Wanderings on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: SVL 1.5: A weekend in Michigan
item.description: <p> <img class="aligncenter" src="https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ui=2&ik=bc3f134ea3&view=att&th=147c738735f746ac&attid=0.3&disp=emb&realattid=ii_hyqcavj23_147c7125b21f0304&zw&atsh=1" alt="" width="342" height="456" /> </div> <p> <img class="aligncenter" src="https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ui=2&ik=bc3f134ea3&view=att&th=147c738735f746ac&attid=0.6&disp=emb&realattid=ii_hyqcavdy2_147c7125b21f0304&zw&atsh=1" alt="" width="342" height="456" /> </div> <p> <img class="aligncenter" src="https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ui=2&ik=bc3f134ea3&view=att&th=147c738735f746ac&attid=0.1&disp=emb&realattid=ii_hyqcav8a1_147c7125b21f0304&zw&atsh=1" alt="" width="342" height="456" /> </div> </div> <div class="gmail_default"> This was between meeting a group of Santosh&#8217;s friends for Philz coffee and a walk around the Infinite Loop and meeting more of his friends in Zenny, an Ethiopian restaurant in San Jose.

item.title: The Relevance of Culture
item.description: A conversation with an old friend of mine revealed to me that the word culture is too often associated only with religion and ritualism and dismissed as irrelevant.

item.title: Sunnyvale Letters (SVL) 1: Wedding and After
item.description: June 21st 2014 Happy Summer Solstice everyone! ðŸ™‚ I woke up at 5am because of jetlag and my husband, Santosh, is still sleeping. Iâ€™ve been wanting to write every day of the last month but things have been so busy.

item.title: LOG 4.1: Thoughts on a rainy afternoon
item.description: 14th September 2013 Hello everyone, I live close to the Uni so my daily space is very small. But recently I have visited my old flatmate Lea in Bremen once for dinner and once for their housewarming party.

item.title: Starry night
item.description: The stars are so pure in their brightness tonight. No earthly sources of light can begin to compare. Sirius sparkled in a clean and loud tone as the others seemed to harmonise in the music of the galaxy.

item.title: Feel good links
item.description: Iâ€™d like to share here some of the interesting links Iâ€™ve read recently: This oneis the less covered story about ordinary and good Indian men. After all the nasty stories weâ€™ve read, this comes as a breath of fresh air and points out all the nice qualities Indian man have.

item.title: Come dream with me
item.description: What does our country really need? We need to make sure every citizen gets enough to eat, clothe themselves and opportunity to enrich themselves using good quality education, and employment.

item.title: Prologue III
item.description: Where are you? Iâ€™m here, waiting But no longer half; Iâ€™m now a grown woman Strong, independent and capable Living every day well; I find happiness in

item.title: LOG 2.3: Kramermarkt
item.description: 9th October, 2011 Hello all! It is cold and rainy here as I write. Just last week, I could wear a dress, and yesterday I had to pull out a heavy jacket to go out!

item.title: Introduction to the Indian Caste System
Thoughts about going Vegan
item.description: I was raised vegetarian and my family has been vegetarian for generations. When I was thirteen or fourteen, my parents told me that since I will be travelling when I get older, I could start getting used to meat if I wanted to.

item.title: How to encourage mutual respect between men and women in India
item.description: INTRODUCTION The gang-rape and death of Jyothi Singh Pandey who was previously known in the media as Damini or Nirbhaya, was the tipping point in bringing to focus a long suffered issue of disrespect and violence towards women in India.

item.title: LOG 1.24: Coming home :)
item.description: 5th August, 2011 This time next week, I will be home. I canâ€™t tell you how excited I am! When I was translating a song which talked about Idlys in one line, /2011/07/29/balailakka-balailakka-lyrics-and-translation-with-end-notes/I looked them up to share an image link for those readers who donâ€™t know what it is.

item.title: The only way forward
item.description: I tend to avoid the news when I can. It upsets me and since I canâ€™t do much about most of those issues far away I satisfy myself by trying to live in the best way I can; compassionately, sincerely and respectfully.

item.title: LOG 1.14: A Trip to GÃ¶ttingen
item.description: 10th April, 2011 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I just returned from a trip to GÃ¶ttingen where my flatmates and I celebrated an old flatmateâ€™s birthday. We took a train yesterday morning and I was quite taken in by the beauty of the countryside.

item.title: Spiritual, religious or philosophical?
item.description: Many people confuse spirituality with religiousness, and philosophy with spirituality. Here I will attempt to tease out the differences as I see them. To be religious is to follow a given set of rules generally defined by an existing system of organised faith.

item.title: Laughing fits
item.description: A lot of people who know me think I am a pretty serious person. Maybe itâ€™s because I have a tendency to intensify conversations. But as serious/intellectual/deep I get, I can go equally crazy.

item.title: LOG 1.12: DMT, The Discovery of Dro"gen Hasen Weg and the Super Extreme Moon
item.description: 18th March, 2011 Hello everyone, I watched this video recently. http://www.esoterictube.com/dmt-the-spirit-molecule.htmlIt corresponds with what Joseph Campbell says about the spiritual world (as represented by myths and anecdotes from those who meditate, and shamans), drugs and psychological diseases like schizophrenia.

item.title: A Brave New World of Equilibrium
item.description: The battle between emotion and control is an old one. It is fought by each of us in our lives as well as philosophers at a more conceptual level.

item.title: LOG 1.10: The first signs
item.description: 28th February, 2011 Hello, It is now possible to see the first signs of Spring. The trees are bearing buds that will leaf and flower forth.

item.title: LOG 1.5: Snow, it turns to rain
item.description: 15th January, 2011 Hello everyone, It has been a while since I last wrote. Iâ€™ve been busy seeing houses, working (:O ! :)), and going out with friends.

item.title: LOG 1.4: Beauty and the Beasts
item.description: 30th December, 2010 Hello everyone, Another â€˜Old Yearâ€™ has gone by â€¦ well I hope it was as happy as it couldâ€™ve been for everyone. So many things have happened, so many new things have been learnt!

item.title: An unfeeling mouth
item.description: I canÂ´t feel most of my mouth. My tongue can move but canÂ´t taste or feel touch. My bottom lip feels like my tongue sticking out of my mouth in a constant pout.

item.title: The Danger of a Single Story
item.description: I think a lot of people can relate to this. http://www.ted.com/talks/lang/por_pt/chimamanda_adichie_the_danger_of_a_single_story.htmlFrom an Indian perspective, I think this is definitely worth passing on to those who make a big deal of stories like Slum Dog Millionaire.

item.title: Â´Unlucky knock on woodÂ´ by C.K. Meena
item.description: C.K. Meena is a columnist in The Hindu, one of IndiaÂ´s biggest news papers. She was my teacher when I took up a certificate course in Journalism and we soon became friends.

item.title: "What's your deal with Roger Federer?"
item.description: Roger Federerjust won his 7th Wimbledon Championship lifting him back to his rightful place as World No. 1. He is the greatest Tennis player of all time.

item.title: A Sleep Deprived Mind
item.description: I woke up early and worked all day. Had very little lunch but instead of eating dinner at eight pm as I normally do, I went to sing with my friends until around eleven thirty in the night.

item.title: The Risks involved in Love and Babies
item.description: I lead a straightforward and simple life. I work, have light conversations with my colleagues during lunch, come back to my flat, cook, hang out with my flatmates or other friends, read, sing, Skype with family and friends in other countries, and watch series like Star Trek and Greyâ€™s Anatomy.

item.title: All hot air
item.description: I asked my brother and my father and they both said I have never been on a hot air balloon ride to their knowledge. If this happened, it was definitely more than 12 years ago with some friends, in Australia, because it feels like an old memory.

item.title: Reflections on God 7: Current Beliefs
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Views on other beliefs I retain a relatively moderate view on people who take an external god literally, so long as they never cross the line of violence especially with children, nature or other cultures.

item.title: Reflections on God 5: Yoga
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Yoga I took up Yoga classes in the holidays between my BSc and MSc mainly to address a back problem I had developed by using a tilted chair.

item.title: Reflections on God 4: Hindu Mythology and Philosophy
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Ka, Doniger, Joseph Campbell Before entering the waters of atheism again, let me mention the other influences I had during and a little after my undergraduate years.

item.title: Reflections on God 3: The Other Cheek of Christianity
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. The other cheek of Christianity During my undergraduate course, I joined the choir and sang songs praising Jesus.

item.title: Reflections on God 2: Deep Ecology and Buddhism
item.description: This is part of God Flux but written in smaller sections for an easier read. Compassion So I put together my own version of god. Almost an imaginary friend.

item.title: Fair is not Lovely
item.description: Dear Women of India, I hope you will soon learn to laugh at the ads which endorse the notion that having lighter brown skin makes you more beautiful than you are already.

item.title: Reflections on God 1: Childhood Atheism and Introduction to Kabir Poetry
item.description: This is part of God Flux but written in smaller sections for an easier read. Basic Atheism As a child I was taught to worship Hindu gods in temples and during Poojas (auspicious days/festivals) at home.

item.title: God Flux; Reflection on a Spiritual Journey
item.description: I have wondered about the concept of god all my life so far. I would like to describe and reflect on my journey so far.

item.title: Frames of Reference
item.description: A colleague of mine is taking German lessons and when the topic of poetry came up at lunch, he described Elftans, and their structure. It reminded me a little of Haiku so I said Â¨Sounds like the European version of HaikuÂ¨.

item.title: Dreaming Through Â´KaÂ´
item.description: The author seems to be trying to achieve the effect of time all being one moment. The effect of this hits the reader in full force in the end when it goes back to Garuda, who was last mentioned in the first chapter reading the Rg Veda, waking up from a light doze on the word â€˜Kaâ€™.

item.title: On a Snowy morning
item.description: When I was 7 and I was about to fly to Australia, I told my grandparents that I will bring some clouds back with me for them.

item.title: The Wait
item.description: March 2009 She waited at the coffee shop. The shadows lengthened and the new March leaves caught the evening light. Music played unnecessarily loudly in the background.

item.title: Adult
item.description: 25th May 2007 I suddenly realize I am a machine. I do the same things everyday. Iâ€™ve stopped feeling. Iâ€™ve stopped thinking. Iâ€™m too busy with my life.

item.title: You Tear It Up
item.description: From Feb 2009 You tear it up I pick up the pieces and reuse You listen to cruel experiments without flinching I feel sick and want to cry

item.title: For Now
item.description: October 2008 This yellow evening, Winds tell of rains to come. A healthy, happy wind That I havenâ€™t felt for so long. Dry mango leaves

item.title: The Joke
item.description: August 23rd, 2008 If I was constantly aware of my place in this universe- as an individual of one of the millions of species of one of the billions of planets- it would constantly strike me a little ridiculous what a big deal I make of myself.

item.title: Insanity?
item.description: From May 2008 How intensely have you questioned your sanity? Today my brain perceived differently- I saw at angles I hadnâ€™t seen before and heard at times I couldnâ€™t explain.

item.title: On a Modified Version of Democracy
item.description: From May 2008 Those of my regular readers in Karnataka will know about the elections held recently. This being my first opportunity to exercise my vote, I thought about it a great deal.

item.title: Our part in world violence (Tibet)
item.description: From May 11, 2008 Violence and aggression rise from fear and greed. What gives the Chinese the right to violate human rights? To kill and torture people?

item.title: God and Love
item.description: From April 2008: Words like love and god are of the most ambiguous. What do people mean when they ask â€˜do you believe in godâ€™ or say â€˜I love youâ€™.

item.title: A Study of Communalism and Identity
item.description: A Study of Communalism and Identity (First published in May 2008) I Identities Preferences and Behaviour Where does the self come from? Identity and our definitions of our â€˜selfâ€™ are a result of what weâ€™ve been taught from the beginning of our lives.

item.title: Path
item.description: March 2002 . From where we come, we go back But where do we go in the middle? We follow a path, A path that is not there.

item.title: Existence
item.description: From December 2007 I think that wasting time is criminal. Somehow, there has to be a purpose to everything. And when there is none, I feel like I donâ€™t deserve to exist.

item.title: My Window
item.description: From November 29th, 2007 Windows can be seen as our outlooks to the world. There are times when oneâ€™s window shrinks to the size of a peephole, moments of fear or hatred.

item.title: Idealism knocked down
item.description: From November 2007 Channel the feelings into art and in that preoccupation, the feelings are absorbed more easily; like a flood, which suddenly found the porous route to the storm drains.

item.title: Anger
item.description: First published in August 2008 Anger. Like a vengeful human on a leash If you were to be freed What damage, what destructionâ€¦ What chaos.

item.title: Reflection
item.description: First published on October 2007 I look for my reflection I love my reflection. It isnâ€™t me but my only companion Through life. And sometimes it is me.

item.title: This Pebble
item.description: First published on 24th October, 2006 This Pebble; Pure while at heart but a tinge of brown outside. Smooth, but for a few cracks through which the blankness

item.title: Missing Mountains
item.description: First published in September 2007 . This prison. Walls. No trees. No where to hide To be alone or cry. No one to understand the loverâ€™s yearning for the mountains

item.title: City
item.description: Written in December 2006 . There is no wholesome plant here There is no learning No passion. Being with the dead kills me. . There arenâ€™t enough trees

item.title: Silver Haired Goddess
item.description: (Written about my grandmother October 2006) The sun lights up her silver hair She walks gracefully past in her fresh light sari. Sheâ€™s a goddess from above.

item.title: A Passing Thought about 'Chicks' and 'Babes'
item.description: Published first on August 30, 2007 The brain stews some ingredients When the time is right, the aroma emergesâ€¦ Thoughts are like passing cloudsâ€¦ It strikes me that respect is a rare feeling amongst people.

item.title: Flakes
item.description: Written in Feb 2007 The season changes Clouds cover parts of The sky. I lose peace. Moisture in the wind Falling leaves; dry and Brittle. Wait for rain.

item.title: The Amazon and us
item.description: First published on August 12, 2007 _â€œIn the time it takes to sing this song, Thereâ€™ll be four acres cleared in the Amazon. The jungle burns all through the night,

item.title: Earth
item.description: June 5th 2008: There is vulnerability In the bud, and Small new leaves. In all young, Newborns sprouting Into Life. There is freshness in Water- life-giving

item.title: At the Neem Tree
item.description: August 12, 2007 . . I walk to my Friends in silence, Drop my bag and jacket on the way Carelessly let loose my hair.

item.title: LfE 15: A visit to Oxford and Thoughts in Slough
item.description: 29/12/2009 Hello ðŸ™‚ I have been in Slough, a town near London, for around two weeks now. It has been restful to spend time with family, watch movies, go shopping etc.

item.title: Chopin's Nostalgia: Ballade No. 2 in F Major op. 38
item.description: Chopin has always been the most real sound track of my life. I got to know some of his most popular pieces as a nine year old in Australia when Readerâ€™s Digest sent the CD for my mum.

item.title: The First and Last Freedom (TFALF) 3: Thoughts during "Individual and Society"
item.description: Is the individual an instrument of society or does the society exist for the individual? In the first paragraph K creates this black and white sense of options.

item.title: What I learnt from my Grandmother
item.description: On Gandhiâ€™s birthday I think of two people. One is my cousin who shares his birthday and the other is my maternal grandma who taught me most of what I know about Gandhian values.

item.title: The First and Last Freedom: Thoughts during Chapter 1
item.description: Different approaches are necessary for different types of books; Novels and most popular science books are meant to be read cover to cover. Dictionaries, encyclopedias and other factual texts are meant to be looked up for specific information.

item.title: Understanding India using Europe
item.description: It is too difficult for a European to see India as one country when they understand itâ€™s diversity is more at the scale of a continent â€“ their continent.

item.title: Android body vs Human body
item.description: A lot of futuristic science fiction puts forward several ideas of what an android would be like. Data from Star Trek (TNG) is an intriguing character who tries very hard to understand what it is to be human.

item.title: Arranged Marriage
item.description: Arranged marriage is an old concept. It existed long before people accepted love (that occurred before marriage) as a valid reason to marry. The process through which this changed is reflected very well in the movie â€˜Fiddler on the Roofâ€™.

item.title: Types of Love: An Analysis.
item.description: It is perhaps important to differentiate the various meaning that we refer to when we say the word love. Often â€˜loveâ€™ is used in the place of a more suitable word.

item.title: Plums
item.description: Four plums on my table Dark red and ripe. Sweet and juicy. I also have chocolate cream biscuits In the shelf The sun will rise soon and

item.title: Thank you, Frank. It was nice Flying with you!
item.description: When Frank Sinatra sings Fly Me To The Moon and Come Fly with me, I feel like dancing. It resonates and lifts me from my thoughts.

item.title: Prologue II
item.description: Where are you? Iâ€™m here, waiting, Only half. I look up at the black sky And ask the bright stars. Come to me. You are not where I looked.

item.title: No Two Sunsets Are Ever the Same
item.description: August 30th 2008 Everything passes Good and bad, Small and big, Everything. The easiest thing to do is let them pass. Holding on is an effort.

item.title: Humans vs Other creatures
item.description: Are humans better than other creatures? Do we have the right to use them for drug testing and experimentation? Are humans a plague that Earth would be better off without?

item.title: Healing
item.description: Choice Distance Strength Care Food Sleep Preoccupation I feel safer. Iâ€™ll stay this way. Through the window of snowfall I walked. Pain has expressed itself best as it could.

item.title: The closing of brackets
item.description: (Tonightâ€™s gonna be a good night. Plane. Meet shadow. Exotic tan. Triangle. Snow. Lab. New friends. Sunrise Potluck. Movie. Climbing hights. Potluck. Movie. Sunset. New friends.

item.title: That Feeling
item.description: That feeling Buried under layers of Reasons The dread of darkness The disagreeability of some changes It lays dormant Under the Rug The mind thinks

item.title: How to deal with Pain
item.description: How do most people deal with pain? Iâ€™m sure there are lines each of us draws a line â€“ a threshold of tolerance until we agree to take pain killers.

item.title: Paramedic's report
item.description: â€˜Female, early twenties. Severe damage to thoracic area. Unable to breathe fully. BP low and heart rate abnormally high. Patient is conscious and has been reporting feeling like blacking out and inability to think clearly.

item.title: Neither Here Nor There
item.description: She floats Neither here Nor there Her home behind her fills the void she left Her new â€˜homeâ€™ a strange land She looks for answers in Ancient Wisdom

item.title: Where was I?
item.description: I returned from a far away place. Iâ€™ve been near it before but never quite inside. It was a strange place to be. Somehow, I never indulged my need to write while I was there.

item.title: The Sun
item.description: The Sun is bright Golden, radiant It gives us light And warmth Â And because it is so bright It has no knowledge of What darkness is

item.title: Piece of Mind I
item.description: Who am I? Thatâ€™s a known classic philosophical question and Iâ€™ll attempt an answer. Mortal definition- I am a living thing called a human being. I live on Earth.

item.title: Computer Angst etc.
item.description: I sought to study biology, in which the brain fascinated me the most. I sought to study cognitive neuroscience of music and ended up sitting in front of the computer.

item.title: Prologue
item.description: They are my songs. You are my song Yet I wander like untied.

item.title: Today
item.description: The past and the future have converged in the present. This is an unbelievable miracle. Past lives return and the recent past becomes a dark void

item.title: Construction
item.description: What a magnificent construction This tall metal brick tower This world of common definitions Where I am the epitome of purity, Goodness, sincerity and compassion.

item.title: Ode to the Apple
item.description: Oh, Symbol of material Love, The â€˜Appleâ€™ of my eye, Your cold, mountain fragrance, Red beauty, Temptation, By you, we were separated from Eden. Peaceful, wholesome, godly Eden.

item.title: Sunglasses
item.description: Because bright light has recently not been friendly to my eyes, I wore sunglasses when I went out today. Apart form shading the eyes, I found that they have other benefits.

item.title: The Shadow
item.description: Black and white, day and night. Contrasts. There can only be one when the other exists. So it is not all that strange that a bright light casts an intense shadow.
